holidays.name: National Spaghetti Day
holidays.description: A delicious day dedicated to the beloved Italian pasta that twirls its way into hearts worldwide. Perfect for carb lovers to indulge in all things spaghetti!
holidays.origin: This food holiday emerged from popular culture celebrating Italian cuisine's global influence, though no specific creator is known.
holidays.funFact: Spaghetti wasn't always served with tomato sauce; tomatoes became a staple only after they were introduced to Europe from the Americas in the 16th century.

holidays.name: Trivia Day
holidays.description: A day to embrace random facts, show off your knowledge, or challenge your friends with amusing and obscure tidbits about everything under the sun.
holidays.origin: Trivia as a concept dates back to Ancient Rome, but this day was created by trivia enthusiasts to celebrate the joy of obscure knowledge.
holidays.funFact: The word 'trivia' comes from Latin meaning 'the crossroads,' where three roads meet‚Äîa metaphor for commonplace information.

holidays.name: World Braille Day
holidays.description: An observance to recognize the importance of Braille as a means of communication for visually impaired individuals worldwide, promoting accessibility and inclusion.
holidays.origin: Officially proclaimed by the United Nations in 2018 to mark the birthday of Louis Braille, the inventor of the Braille system.
holidays.funFact: Louis Braille was just 15 years old when he developed the Braille alphabet in 1824.
